scenarioDescription:
The HD 164595 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 164595 is a star with 0.99 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 92.15 light years away from the solar system.

HD 164595 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 164595 system


HD 164595 b

HD 164595 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory, in 2015-09, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.23 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 164595 b is 16.148 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 164595 b is 4.160 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 164595 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 164595, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory.
name: HD 164595 - System With 1 Exoplanet
